title: Medical Procedure Technical Language Education Design Through Interactive Workshops

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and multiple professional field experiences, basic medical terminology, and patient education experience
context.additional_context: Students must systematically design medical procedure instruction education based on language domain expertise (medical text analysis, terminology conversion, communication strategies). Includes digital tool-based practice (recorded medical scenario role-plays) and project-based assessments (patient education material development)

learning_goals: Learners can design a linguistic explanation system for a medical procedure skills training module by applying Gagné’s instructional design model
Learners can acquire expression strategies to clearly convey medical terminology using interactive workshop techniques and develop patient-healthcare provider communication scenarios

Through project-based assessment, learners can apply medical procedure training scenarios to real-world contexts and produce explanatory materials that balance specialized terminology with everyday language
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
